findings.lung: Visualized lung fields are within normal limits; no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.
findings.liver: Homogenous attenuation; no focal lesions or biliary dilatation; gallbladder is collapsed.
findings.pancreas: Normal attenuation; no focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation.
findings.spleen: Normal size and attenuation; no focal lesions.
findings.kidneys: Normal and symmetric size with normal nephrogram; a 3.7 x 3.5 cm simple cyst in the lower pole of the left kidney; no perinephric abnormality.
findings.gastrointestinal: Severe inflammation of the sigmoid colon with mucosal hyperemia, adjacent fat stranding, and wall thickening; adjacent lobulated fluid collection concerning for an abscess (measuring 4.4 x 3.6 x 3.5 cm).
findings.bladder: Unremarkable; no free fluid in the pelvis.
findings.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm; extensive atherosclerotic disease noted.
findings.bones: No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture; lumbar spinal degenerative changes are mild-to-moderate.
findings.soft tissue: An umbilical hernia containing fat is noted.
